image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: The three men accused of murdering West Australian brothers Jake and Callum Robinson in Mexico last year face court, as a prosecutor says there are 35 witnesses and forensic evidence in the case against them.

title.children: Prosecutor wants 210-year jail terms for WA brothers' accused killers

image.altText: A man with white hair and beard tries to shield his face with a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: A former Perth teacher who abused four schoolboys in the 1970s and 80s, in behaviour a District Court Judge described as "predatory", is jailed for 16 years.

title.children: 'Predatory' Perth teacher jailed for abusing primary school students

image.altText: A pile of green organic food waste.

props.synopsis: The City of Bunbury and Shire of Harvey agree to contribute up to $1 million each to remove contaminated organic waste that caused the closure of a regional three-bin waste system.

title.children: Councils hit with $2m bill to send contaminated FOGO waste to landfill

image.altText: Two women cutting a cake side by side.

props.synopsis: As Kununurra battles with a surge in youth crime, residents in Fitzroy Crossing are celebrating their success in reducing rates through a community-led initiative.

title.children: Fitzroy Crossing community believes Night Space has broken cycle of crime

image.altText: single storey building with ramp and steps and sign saying REED

props.synopsis: Martha Sawicki says she will have to move towns as she can no longer send her children to the only long day care centre at Hopetoun in WA, following child exploitation charges laid against a man connected to the centre.

title.children: Children pulled from day care after allegations against employee's husband

image.altText: The family of a 49-year-old WA man, whose death was initially linked to the Optus Triple-Zero outage, say they have been kept in the dark by authorities.

props.synopsis: The family of a Perth man whose death was tied to the Optus Triple Zero outage claims authorities left them in the dark for weeks and are still unsure how his death was connected to the telco failure.

title.children: This man's death was linked to the Optus outage, but his family still don't know how

image.altText: A purple and green sky with the silhouettes of big trees

props.synopsis: The strength of the latest geomagnetic storms has seen the aurora australis light up skies across a larger part of the country than usual.

title.children: They're called the southern lights. But they dazzled Australians further north

image.altText: A man in khaki shorts and a hat stands on rocks overlooking a rugged tree-lined gorge.

props.synopsis: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he says have had a positive environmental impact.

title.children: Grazier accepts donkey culling decision but will not do it himself

image.altText: A dark-haired man in a suit speaks at a lectern in front of an "AFL draft" backdrop.

props.synopsis: Another AFL draft has arrived, offering dozens of teenage footballers the chance to realise their dreams. Here is everything you need to know.

title.children: When is the AFL draft and how does it work? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A batsman on his back, having played a scoop shot on a cricket pitch.

props.synopsis: England star Joe Root is yet to score a Test century in Australia and was out for one run despite the team's strong platform in the warm-up match.

title.children: Root's ominous opening innings as England Bazballs in Perth

image.altText: A 'No free camping' sign lit up on the side of the road at night

props.synopsis: A WA council has doubled fines for illegal camping and will look at locking people out of visitor hotspots at night, as it struggles to stop people staying in vans and tents at popular tourist spots.

title.children: Will bigger fines, gates and timed parking stop illegal camping in WA?

image.altText: A mid-shot of Daniela Vecchio posing for a photo outside Council House in Perth with her WA Australian of the Year award.

props.synopsis: The psychiatrist who pioneered the country's first gaming disorder clinic at a public hospital has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for WA.

title.children: Gaming addiction treatment pioneer named Australian of the Year for WA

image.altText: A woman's hand holds a tube of Bondi Sands Zinc Mineral sunscreen.

props.synopsis: A major Australian sunscreen brand, Bondi Sands is the latest to announce recalls over potential SPF concerns, and the first to remove products from shelves that have not been identified as using the same problematic base formulation.

title.children: Bondi Sands the latest brand to recall sunscreens over potential SPF concerns

image.altText: A woman plays with her son using blocks.

props.synopsis: A recall of children’s coloured sand after asbestos traces were found has led to the closure of multiple public schools in the ACT, leaving parents scrambling for care options and answers.

title.children: 'Chaos situation' as asbestos risk in coloured sand causes school closures

image.altText: Boats loaded onboard a large ship.

props.synopsis: An Australian Border Force vessel has docked in Broome carrying four fishing boats, prompting anger from the fishing industry over a government scheme that gives illegal fishers boats to return home in.

title.children: Growing evidence of secret taxpayer-funded boats for illegal foreign fishers

image.altText: A dark-haired man in handcuffs covers his face as he escorted near a court building.

props.synopsis: The 46-year-old committed offences against two children between 2019 and 2020, a Broome jury has found.

title.children: WA man found guilty of raping child tells jury to 'burn in hell'

image.altText: Reflection of person holding umbrella below Nasdaq sign

props.synopsis: The ASX falls steeply in response to a sharp drop on Wall Street overnight, which was led by a big decline in tech stocks. TPG Telecom plunged 32 per cent after the stock traded without rights to the next dividend payment.

title.children: ASX drops sharply after Wall St tumbles — as it happened

image.altText: An older Aboriginal woman leans against a park bench

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder has slammed Andrew Forrest as a state tribunal into plans to alter a WA river hears critical evidence.

title.children: 'Don't hide behind lawyers': Elder blasts Andrew Forrest in WA river case

image.altText: A bald man with sunglasses resting on his forehead looks straight at the camera.

props.synopsis: A Labor MP says he hopes the state's appeal of a multi-million-dollar compensation payout to a child sexual abuse survivor fails, amid mounting criticism from legal experts and advocates.

title.children: Backbencher hopes WA government's Dion Barber compensation appeal fails

image.altText: Two women and two men standing at a podium talking to reporters

props.synopsis: While many Liberals who wanted to keep net zero say they are happy with the position the party has taken, some despondent moderates fear electoral oblivion in metropolitan seats.

title.children: Liberal moderates split over net zero move, with some fearing for city seats

image.altText: Sussan Ley newsletter thumb

props.synopsis: The Liberal conservatives' success in forcing their party to dump its commitment to the net zero emissions reduction target has been a triumph of ideology over pragmatism.

title.children: Liberals deliver slap in the face to voters by dumping net zero

image.altText: A possum-skin quilt built from squares etched with messages about the promise of the treaty process.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of treaties exist between First Nations people and governments around the world. One state in Australia just became one of them.

title.children: Victoria's treaty is here. What does it mean? And is one coming to my state?

image.altText: two girls getting into the back of a police car, two police members stand behind them.

props.synopsis: With young people in Kununurra making news for the wrong reasons over the last month, a police patrol shows the stark reality for children on the streets of the northern WA town.

title.children: Two eight-year-olds with nowhere to go highlight Kununurra's social issues

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande smile at each other and hold hands

props.synopsis: Video shared across social media shows a man jumping over a crowd-control barrier, running towards Grande and putting his arms around the singer.

title.children: Cynthia Erivo pushes Australian 'serial intruder' off Ariana Grande at event

image.altText: rbui

props.synopsis: The former president of Spain's national football federation, who made headlines after his behaviour following the final of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, has had eggs thrown at him during the launch of his book.

title.children: Luis Rubiales, famed for World Cup kiss, pelted with eggs at book launch

image.altText: A portrait of a South Asian Australian woman in her early 30s, wearing a floral dress, smiling brightly.

props.synopsis: This year, Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa earned an Order of Australia medal and published her first book, Fully Sikh, all while running an indie theatre in Perth.

title.children: Meet the 31-year-old Perth CEO whose career started at a poetry slam

image.altText: A tall thin rocket takes off from launch pad, vertically, against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Blue Origin has successfully launched the 98-metre New Glenn rocket with a pair of NASA spacecraft destined for Mars.

title.children: Blue Origin launches huge rocket carrying twin NASA spacecraft to Mars

image.altText: a black and white photo of two men talking into microphones

props.synopsis: Forty years ago, the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

title.children: Top lawyer returns to unfinished business in Wittenoom asbestos saga

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Virginia Giuffre and Ghislaine Maxwell posing for a picture.

props.synopsis: The former prince has repeatedly denied ever meeting Ms Roberts Giuffre, including during an infamous interview with the BBC in 2019.

title.children: Epstein email says Andrew had photo taken with accuser Virginia Roberts Giuffre

image.altText: A female golfer looks down the fairway after her ball after completing her first shot on a hole at an LPGA tournament.

props.synopsis: Kai Trump, teenage granddaughter of US President Donald Trump, has a rough start to The Annika tournament after receiving a sponsors invite to take part in the LPGA Tour event.

title.children: Trump's granddaughter last in LPGA debut after receiving wildcard

image.altText: Two happy dogs, one large and one small, on a beach.

props.synopsis: The huge range of dog breeds that exists today is often thought of as a modern phenomenon, but new research suggests this vast diversity started thousands of years ago.

title.children: Once wolves became dogs they quickly diversified, study shows

image.altText: Linda wears black rimmed glasses and a blue blazer as she smiles

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds is suing the Commonwealth and its lawyers over the handling of Brittany Higgins' $2.4 million compensation settlement, yet has removed specific allegations against the former Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus.

title.children: With 'reputational vindication' already achieved, Reynolds targets 'financial vindication'

image.altText: A grain silo looms in front of a starry purple, pink and green sky

props.synopsis: Another week is behind us Can you recall the big news stories of the past seven days?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Black Friday sales, a stunning aurora and a whole lot of bagpipes
